name: aloft Philadelphia Airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our one night stay was due to US Air flight cancellation. My husband and I were curious to experience this new hotel where we were assigned for the night. Initially there was a backup at the round reception area due to the numerous passengers checking in from the cancelled flight, but everyone was patient and the process went quickly. We noticed the contemporary lobby, with its plasma screens, and hip decor. Our room on the 5th floor was on the small side but was quiet and worked out very well for the night. Note: probably not the best place for more than a couple of nights, due to storage constraints. The platform bed was extremely comfortable, the shower had two dispensers built in with Bliss products and the decor was modern and trendy. Like others who have written, the shades did allow more light in than needed in the morning. The internet connection was very fast. I made the mistake of having a cup of the "Steep and Steam" citrus green tea and stayed up all night from the caffeine. Who knew??? The front desk people were always helpful and friendly. The wake-up call came as requested. The do-it-yourself breakfast area was just marginal. Their version of an eggmuffin was not the best choice, but all in all, I would definitely stay there again.
reviews.title: Good place to stay when you're flight is cancelled

reviews.text: The aLoft hotel near the Philadelphia airport was a refreshing change to the traditional finds. The outside was pretty dull, but the inside is ultra modern and chic. The decor lends itself nicely to a younger contemporary crowd ~ seeking something outside of the box. The rooms are spotless with a beautful shower, great storage and an awesome flat screen t.v. The bed is crazy comfortable and the window treatments help the room stay dark so you can sleep in :) . The lobby and pool area is mega hip with lots of awesome artwork and lounging areas.
reviews.title: Great hotel for Eagles games!

likes.disliked: — Nothing...it was a wonderful stay with great customer service!

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel while in Philly for an Eagles football game The location near the airport is super easy to access and we got to the stadium really fast. I definetly recommend this hotel over my former favorite the Holiday Inn Stadium (which I hear has Seriously gone down over the last several years). The aloft reminds me a lot of the super trendy (and unbelievably expensive) hotels in Manhattan. Fortunately you can get more square footage at the aLoft PA...and at more than 1/2 the price of NY. Enjoy!
reviews.title: Cool room/convenient location

likes.disliked: — no free parking or free continental breakfast

reviews.text: took advantage of their buy one night/50% off next night offer, bringing average cost per night to around 80.00. Very reasonable for area and super close to PHL airport. Very sleek, ultra-contemporary concept. Bar/lobby area is quite loud at night , but fun. Everything was super clean and very new (property only open a few months). No free continental breakfast but items available for purchase in lobby. didn't look at the offerings so cannot comment on that. Staff is highly energetic and friendly, but the "aloha" will get to you after awhile. I feel they are still working out the kinks, but this is a wonderful concept and young business travelers should really enjoy the property. A few service issues (room never made up, coffee never replaced), while not major, should be noted. When I went to lobby to request coffee packet for next morning since room was never serviced, staff very apologetic, however it took nearly one hour for coffee packet to arrive. Only other issue is the paid-parking. Having stayed at several other PHL airport properties (Embassy Suites, hampton Inn, Hilton) which do not charge to park, it seems like the 6.00 per night can be waived?? All in all, my teenage son really enjoyed the stay, it is quite fun and reasonably priced, but I probably would pick a different place next time I needed to be in this area, unless the Aloft priced out MUCH lower than the others.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Place

likes.liked: — The decor was fresh and out of the ordinary.
likes.disliked: — The lobby music was too loud.

reviews.text: The aLoft is a great, reasonably priced place to stay near the airport in Philly. The rooms are contemporary in decor which is refreshing. When you walk into the lobby you may not be sure you're in the right place, but you are. It looks like a bar when you walk in. That's just the style. The loud music in the lobby also bothered me because I worried I'd be able to hear it all the way up to my room, but I couldn't.
reviews.title: The Perfect getaway

reviews.text: This hotel has the potential to be a great hotel but small issues added up quickly. After spending about 10 minutes at the kiosk to check in, I was then told I needed to go to the Front Desk to get my keys. The kiosk is a marketing ploy to be different, so its important to get this right.
reviews.title: Great potential but currently not up to snuff

likes.liked: — Unusual vibe in the lobby, great intro rate

reviews.text: The room was nice with a good sized bathroom. I also liked the fitness center and the new running machines were awesome.
reviews.title: Didn't meet expectations

likes.disliked: — The sleeping conditions (loud AC, poor blinds)

reviews.text: Great place - and surprisingly inexpensive. Stayed there because I had an early flight from PHL - was a quick drive to the airport - easy to get in and out. The rooms were SUCH an interesting break from the norm (i travel a lot for business and get bored of the same old set up). Bliss products - great flat screen - plenty of space. Great if you're arriving late - they have a lot of food/drinks available and a good selection. I'd definitely stay here again and can't wait to see more open up.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — layout of the room and amenities
likes.disliked: — check in kiosk took a long time

reviews.title: Also had "small issues that added up"
reviews.text: In theory I really like this concept, and there are some things about it that are really awesome. This Starwood product caters to the younger, trendier traveler and features a price point that's quite a bit lower than other Starwood brands. The furnishings and lobby have a European feel, and it's all very design-y and cool - I love the in-room magazine selection and the bath products are specially made for Aloft by the fantastic Bliss company (you can buy them online but they're expensive, like other Bliss products). However, having stayed in other Aloft properties, I can tell you the PHL hotel needs a bit of work. I'm a Starwood Gold member and like another reviewer, I don't think there's much at Aloft properties even available by means of upgrade. I didn't notice a program member's floor, either.

* There's a "jack box" on top of the desk near the telly that supposedly will allow you to plug in a laptop, IPod, what have you to watch your own media. Mine simply didn't work. When I called down to the desk, a well-meaning but not very effective engineer showed up to tweak the system a few times - coming and going - I appreciated the effort but I'd really like for it to have worked without my spending 45 minutes answering the door while he went to get different pieces of equipment. He never did get it working. I tried to change rooms to be able to use the AV system but he told me the entire hotel was suffering an outage. I'm dubious.
reviews.title: Strange Concept But Very Cool Staff

likes.liked: — The Rocking chair near the pool tables

reviews.text: * The AV system also functions as an alarm clock, rather than guests' being able to use the old-fashioned kind. (There's a clock in the room but I'm not sure it even has an alarm feature, although I'm sure you could still also get a wakeup call from the front desk.) You're intended to set the television to come on at a certain time, thus awakening you. This would be great in the abstract, but - no lie - my television switched on at 6 AM both nights I stayed here (in room 317). I changed the alarm time on the system repeatedly - language indicated the time set was meant not to carry over from day to day - but to no avail. This was really no fun, as I was up very late both nights I stayed here, had busy days and could have used some good shuteye.
reviews.title: Trendy and Modern with drawbacks

likes.disliked: — Lack of places to hang/put away clothes

reviews.text: * There was a loud (LOUD) party in the lobby on Friday night. I stayed on the third floor and could hear the music quite clearly through the walls and floor until after 2 AM. It would have been nice to know this was going to happen before I booked at this property. The music in the lobby was positively deafening as I came in from my car. They did give me a free pair of earplugs when I went down and asked, but keeping music blaring until 2 AM seems a little extreme.
reviews.title: quite satisfied again with the aloft brand

reviews.text: Love the room, the concept, everything about the hotel. It seems like it is geared towards younger travelers but I can imagine older couples will still enjoy the stay. I see some kids and parents enjoying the heated swimming pool. The hotel is also equipped with a hip bar, pool table, selection of board games, and a well-maintained gym. The bedroom design makes you feel like at home. Did I also mention a 42" flat screen HDTV?? Gotta give it a try!
reviews.title: Loved it!!

likes.liked: — The overal hotel concept and experience

reviews.text: I'm not sure what to say... Other then I love the concept and I think Starwood is on to something big here. I am a Gold SPG member and this was my first visit to an Aloft property. I was impressed with the swanky lobby, funky decor and friendly service at registration. The hotel is a great deal for the price and as long as Starwood keeps it reasonable its a real value. But SPG Gold/Platinum Members beware. This is not a full service property and only room types here are Queen or 2-Dbls. There is no upgrade, there is no recognition other then level key card holder. There is no SPG floor. There is a sign at the front desk. But there is no dedicated check in for Elite Members. Basically they don't really care here weather you are Elite or not. The front desk agent that greeted me with a loud "Aloha Sir" was wearing a Aloft branded polo shirt and khakis with a peace sign pin on his lapel did not really care if I was SPG member or not. If this is part of the concept or not im not sure. If it is its a bold move for SPG which has traditionally valued its elite members more then any other chain. I was really out of by this. Not to mention that at check out my SPG number was not even added to my folio so I was not going to get my points.
reviews.title: Cheap Chic - FABULOUS CONCEPT !!!

likes.disliked: — No regard for elite members of SPG

reviews.text: What you get is a funky, groovy hotel that works. Its a great lobby scene. I stayed for 2 nights and the lobby always had a crowd. Young and energetic. Room was new and very functional. Firm and comfortable bedding. You get 2 bottles of water complimentary each day and there is a refrigerator in each room. The hotel is in a secured compound with two other Starwood property's. Very safe to park at night. Very well lighted and convenient to airport and I-95. Pool and gym are great. Better then some full service hotels. Snacks and fun stuff available for purchase 24 hours a day at reasonable prices. In room amenity's are from Bliss and they are fantastic. The rooms all have a free safe and digital climate control. The A/C is the wall type under the window and while ti works very well. It is very loud. But I guess you can drown it all out with your 42 Inch - wall mounted - LG Plasma TV with surround sound. It was all HD cable and it was awesome.
reviews.title: Decent Airport Hotel

reviews.text: I am concerned that the hotel opened in October and already its showing some tear. My housekeeper did a terrible job of cleaning and the floors in the bathroom you can tell don't get cleaned much. They look ok now because they are new. But this time next year they wont be looking so good at the rate they are going. Carpets in hallways (5th floor - top floor - Is where I stayed) where not vacuumed properly and always had dust and debris. The elevators where not very clean. The door to the back room/office that's opposite the check in pod was always kept open by the night clerk. This looked terrible and really took away from the experience. There are already light bulbs that are being replaced with different bulbs then the original ones used. Also some bulbs are just out. Clearly not a very good maintenance department here. This is a new property and a significant investment or the Starwood brand. I am surprised there is not better upkeep.
reviews.title: Refreshing change from the standard biz experience

likes.liked: — casual, youthful energy, fresh food available 24/7

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The service is friendly and relaxed. But don't expect a whole lot. They are always understaffed and have only one person for a 150+ room property at night. This presents a real challenge as this person checks in - answers phones - and does everything.
reviews.title: A Little European in the USA

description: Aloft Philadelphia Airport offers guests a bold, new travel experience just minutes from downtown Philadelphia and conveniently located near Philadelphia International Airport (free shuttle service).
